bill_title: revise certain requirements related to nonresident fishing licenses.
keywords: Department of Game, Fish, and Parks

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain requirements related to nonresident fishing licenses. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 41-6-36 be amended to read as follows: 41-6-36. A nonresident fishing license entitles the licensee to all the privileges of a resident fishing license for one period of ten days or two periods of five days . The license shall describe the licensee and designate place of residence and post office address. The license fee for a nonresident fishing license may not be less than the fee for a nonresident small game license. Section 2. That § 41-6-37.1 be amended to read as follows: 41-6-37.1. A nonresident family fishing license entitles a nonresident licensee and the licensee's immediate family, to all the privileges of resident fishing licenses for one period of ten days or two periods of five days . The fee and daily and possession limit for a nonresident family fishing license shall be set by rules promulgated by the Game, Fish and Parks Commission pursuant to chapter 1-26. The fee may not be less than the fee for a nonresident small game license. The license shall describe the licensee and shall designate the licensee's place of residence and post office address. For purposes of this section, the term, immediate family, means the licensee, the licensee's spouse, and the licensee's children under the age of sixteen.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
